data: Characterisation Of A Green Microenvironment And To Study Its Impact Upon Health and Well-Being in The Elderly As A Way Forward For Health Tourism.

Our society in Europe is still under prepared for the demographic changing situation of an ageing population which began several decades ago. This is visible in the age structure of the population and is reflected by the fact that the population aged 65 years and over is increasing in every European country. The growth in the elderly population may be explained by increased longevity, but at the same time, we also see an increase in debilitating conditions. However, it is also clear that the elderly are afflicted by challenging health conditions as a direct consequence of being elderly which impact their quality of life (QOL), e.g. living alone, depression, recovery from illness, immobility. This is what we would like to address. Living longer should be a privilege but there has been a collective failure to address social implications and QOL issues, where social care and the way it is funded are already in crisis. Our aim in this project is to couple the need for new societal approaches in addressing this changing demographic with improving the economy of green microenvironment sites, where health tourism and creating new jobs in this sector would in turn fund and provide benefits with respect to the well-being of the elderly. The ultimate outcome, through this pan-European academic and industrial project, will be: a) to derive cross-disciplinary and inter-sectorial knowledge of how to improve physical and mental well-being in the elderly, b) to characterise the environmental geology of Nemi and to correlate the identified features with improvements in health, well-being and recovery, c) to train a new generation of specialists in the sector of recreation and health for the tourism industry, d) the training of specialists in social and therapeutic horticulture (STH) as a way to improve physical and mental health, e) to create a model for health tourism, and f) to produce a business plan with an economic impact analysis.

Sutton Coldfield YMCA has a sucessful history of international youth work. As such we see our participation in the European Voluntary Service as an expansion of the services we offer to young people. Sutton Coldfield YMCA's objectives are to provide opportunities for personal growth, skills and abilities developmentTo provide for the volunteer the context for intercultural expression, creativity and innovation Promote and develop non formal education as a method for active citizenship and civic involvement of youngsters.Offering culture related activities to let participants actively learn to set their own culture backgrounds and experiences in relation to other participants of the programme.We think that the European Voluntary Service aims to provide young voluntary workers with an intercultural learning experience and the opportunity to acquire many skills which will be useful for their social and professional integration.Sutton Coldfield YMCA offers a variety of cultural and leisure-time activities, advice, support and help. We work closely together with other organisations in the local community. By hosting a volunteer, we want to make the volunteer aware of how valued their contribution to this work will be. We are offering a youth work/childrens programme for young volunteers,  a training programme about cultural diversity/life skills for young people, a programme for young people with disabilities, a programme for young people in a caring role of either a parent or sibling . Further more we cooperate with the local churches and schools in several projects for children together. (including youth clubs)The role of the volunteer should mainly be to offer his/her special skills connected to and co-ordinated with the program and projects of Sutton ColdfieldYMCA and the local community. The volunteer has the possibility to be part of various projects and will have the opportunity to develop own projects and activities.Activities could be: meeting other residents, offering play activities for young children, connect and support with parents, assisting staff in project life skill lessons, organising free-time activities for young people like going to the cinema, going to disco, theatre etc, helping to plan and run social activities for young people, help to plan, organise and run events like summer/Christmas parties, charity events, concerts, talks etc...  Duration of service for the volunteers is 12 months, the project takes place in Sutton Coldfield (Birmingham UK)

The role of the volunteer should mainly be to offer his/her special skills connected to and co-ordinated with the program and projects of Sutton ColdfieldYMCA  and the local community. The volunteer has the possibility to be part of various projects and will have the opportunity to develop own projects and activities.

Activities could be: 
meeting other residents, offering play activities for young children, connect and support with parents, assisting staff in project life skill lessons, organising free-time activities for young people like going to the cinema, going to disco, theatre etc, helping to plan and run social activities for young people, help to plan, organise and run events like summer/Christmas parties, charity events, concerts, talks etc...  
We think that the European Voluntary Service aims to provide young voluntary workers with an intercultural learning experience and the opportunity to acquire many skills which will be useful for their social and professional integration.
Sutton Coldfield YMCA offers a variety of cultural and leisure-time activities, advice, support and help. We work closely together with other organisations in the local community. By hosting a volunteer, we want to make the volunteer aware of how valued their contribution to this work will be. We are offering a youth work/childrens programme for young volunteers,  a training programme about cultural diversity/life skills for young people, a programme for young people with disabilities, a programme for young people in a caring role of either a parent or sibling . Further more we cooperate with the local churches and schools in several projects for children together. (including youth clubs)
Duration of service for the volunteers is 12 months, the project takes place in Sutton Coldfield (Birmingham UK)
The Centre national Information Jeunes and Sutton ColdfieldYMCA are commitment to prepare the logistic in order to send and received the volunteers ( travel, accommodation, insurance, safety and protection of participants, visa, social security, mentoring and support, preparatory meetings with partners etc.) according with the standards of the Erasmus + programme.

Sutton Coldfield YMCA has a sucessful history of international youth work. As such we see our participation in the European Voluntary Service as an expansion of the services we offer to young people. Sutton Coldfield YMCA's objectives are to provide opportunities for personal growth, skills and abilities development
To provide for the volunteer the context for intercultural expression, creativity and innovation 
Promote and develop non formal education as a method for active citizenship and civic involvement of youngsters.
Offering culture related activities to let participants actively learn to set their own culture backgrounds and experiences in relation to other participants of the programme.

We think that the European Voluntary Service aims to provide young voluntary workers with an intercultural learning experience and the opportunity to acquire many skills which will be useful for their social and professional integration.
Sutton Coldfield YMCA offers a variety of cultural and leisure-time activities, advice, support and help. We work closely together with other organisations in the local community. By hosting a volunteer, we want to make the volunteer aware of how valued their contribution to this work will be. We are offering a youth work/childrens programme for young volunteers,  a training programme about cultural diversity/life skills for young people, a programme for young people with disabilities, a programme for young people in a caring role of either a parent or sibling . Further more we cooperate with the local churches and schools in several projects for children together. (including youth clubs)

The role of the volunteer should mainly be to offer his/her special skills connected to and co-ordinated with the program and projects of Sutton ColdfieldYMCA and the local community. The volunteer has the possibility to be part of various projects and will have the opportunity to develop own projects and activities.

Activities could be: 
meeting other residents, offering play activities for young children, connect and support with parents, assisting staff in project life skill lessons, organising free-time activities for young people like going to the cinema, going to disco, theatre etc, helping to plan and run social activities for young people, help to plan, organise and run events like summer/Christmas parties, charity events, concerts, talks etc...  
Duration of service for the volunteers is 12 months, the project takes place in Sutton Coldfield (Birmingham UK)

The increasing poverty and social exclusion in Europe, especially among young people between 16 and 24 years, is one of the worst consequences of the current international economic crisis. Young people with economic, social, educational and geographical difficulties may converge towards a downward spiral that could prevent them from having real possibilities of access to the European labor market. Youth organizations who work daily with young people with fewer opportunities are a real possibility for them, the gateway to a future inclusion. The partnership created for this project strongly believes in this challenge, aware that non-formal education methods represent an essential tool in the fight against social exclusion, and promoting youth participation and initiative. We therefore believe that we must act internationally to workers and youth organizations can provide resources, tools, methodologies, knowledge and skills, particularly digital, to promote new educational pathways in order to combat social exclusion.Our association intends to organize a seminar on the duration of six days, from 17 to 22 October 2016 in which include a total of 26 youth workers in order to acquire or upgrade skills and digital literacy in developing their activities with young people with fewer opportunities, especially those at risk of social exclusion.Specific project objectives include:- Display tools and job search strategies and the promotion of personal branding online European youth workers who perform their activities with young people with fewer opportunities.- Identify the benefits of Web 3.0 to promote youth employment and entrepreneurship, so that our professional profile more interesting, communications applications know how to contact the companies, design and brand management staff , communication, marketing, etc.- Know the basic guidelines for effective participation in these networks in order to raise awareness of career guidance for unemployed youth (complete your profile, give it a more professional appearance, set restrictions, build brand image, etc.).- Know the main resources of existing jobs in Europe and how to facilitate access to them from any European country.- Provide resources for self-employment for young people with fewer opportunities.- Improving the image of European policies related to employment, international mobility and youth through case studies and specific documentation.The methodology will be based primarily in the transmission of theoretical knowledge through audiovisual support such as PowerPoint presentations, prezi and videos, combined with practical work about the contents and tools used. We will discuss a number of online tools and do tests on them. All information is shared and stored in a google drive that teach how to use efficiently. The sessions will be open and participatory at all times, with specific dynamics and ice breaker.In particular we will work in teams with tools that facilitate us the practical application of knowledge through roll-play and group dynamics.We hope the results of the project can generate a direct impact on participants and partner organizations as well as, indirectly, in young users of the organizations and other youth associations and workers who receive information and materials produced during the activity. Digital skills acquired will improve the training routes for young people with fewer opportunities, increasing the participation and youth initiative and reducing social exclusion.The creation of a future network of partners guarantee us deeper into the issue of social exclusion working together to carry out new and innovative initiatives and replicate similar initiatives in local, national and international levels.

Sutton Coldfield YMCA has a sucessful history of international youth work. As such we see our participation in the Erasmus+ programme as an expansion of the services we offer to young people. 


We have met the staff of the BBC last year to learn more about their work with young people and to exchange experiences and ideas. We learned about the limited possibilities of their students to participate in international learning  programmes due to the political/ social situation of the students. In the same time we realised the need within the local community in Sutton Coldfield (Birmingham) to offer more projects for young people from a migration/ Refugee background. As there can be tendencies of separation/isolation and radicalization.
We believe the cooperation with BBC could give all partners a unique learning experience on many levels. One target is to share good practice between the organisations.  Another target is to provide for the young participants the context for intercultural expression, creativity and innovation. 
To Promote and develop non formal education as a method for active citizenship and civic involvement of youngsters.
Offering culture related activities to let participants actively learn to set their own culture backgrounds and experiences in relation to other participants of the programme.

Another aim of this project is to build a long lasting partnership and cooperation between the partners, we hope that this will lead to life long learning that can be filtered down through the young people we work with and then into the communities that we work in. 

We think that the Erasmus + programme aims to provide young people with an intercultural learning experience and the opportunity to acquire many skills and competences which will be useful for their social and professional integration.
Sutton Coldfield YMCA offers a variety of cultural and leisure-time activities, advice, support and help. We work closely together with other organisations in the local community, we have experience of similar creative projects and lots of experience with Youthwork.

There will be 24 participants from 2 countries, and three partner organisations.

Activities could be: 
discussion rounds, role play, singing, dancing, workshops, social outings etc

There will ongoing evaluation through-ought the project. The partners will monitor the learning of the participants and use methods such as youth pass to help evaluate the project.

The role of the volunteer should mainly be to offer his/her special skills connected to and co-ordinated with the program and projects of YMCACW  and the local community. The volunteer has the possibility to be part of various projects and will have the opportunity to develop own projects and activities.

The objectives of the project are to enhance the skills and capacity of young people making them more employable, ensure they have a 'voice and choice' to help innovate the informal training and learning pathway offered to young people, and to raise the aspiration of young people from disadvantaged backgrounds to understand that they can make a positive lasting contribution both near and far!

We will receive two participants on this project who are strong willed, have good work ethics, desire to creatively support their own and others' development and look forward to challenges and are resilient when setbacks or obstacles arise. 

The primary activities planned within the project shall include non-formal educational sessions at a community garden project, community lunches, creative workshop sessions including people with a disability, youth club sessions, sport club sessions, and youth forums. 

Activities could be: 
meeting other residents, offering play activities for young children, connect and support with parents, assisting staff in project life skill lessons, organising free-time activities for young people like going to the cinema, going to disco, theatre etc, helping to plan and run social activities for young people, help to plan, organise and run events like summer/Christmas parties, charity events, concerts, talks etc...  
We think that the European Voluntary Service aims to provide young voluntary workers with an intercultural learning experience and the opportunity to acquire many skills which will be useful for their social and professional integration.
YMCACW offers a variety of cultural and leisure-time activities, advice, support and help. We work closely together with other organisations in the local community. By hosting a volunteer, we want to make the volunteer aware of how valued their contribution to this work will be. We are offering a youth work/childrens programme for young volunteers,  a training programme about cultural diversity/life skills for young people, a programme for young people with disabilities, a programme for young people in a caring role of either a parent or sibling . Further more we cooperate with the local churches and schools in several projects for children together. (including youth clubs)

The working method shall be a mixture of non-formal and informal learning provision and will be supported by the Developmental Relationship approach suggested by the Search Institute, a think-tank on youth development. As an organisation we are in process of embedding this approach and the Developmental Asset Framework as a means of helping shape our programme provision as well as determining the effectiveness of our delivery and support to communities. We would expect the participants on this project to carry this method and approach back to their local contexts and help to share the way of working.

We expect that through participation in the project, young people’s knowledge and ability to put knowledge into action will have increased. That young peoples aspirations to develop an improved future for themselves and others will be developed and enhanced. We anticipate that the participants own sense of European identity will have increased and to have developed a broader sense of what that identity entails and the role that they play within a European and Global context. 

It would be realistic to suggest that the experience would make the volunteers more employable as well as developing an increased capacity for Higher Education in the future as they will have increased their communication skills including their ability to speak, read and write in English. 

We expect that through meeting, working with, and developing relationships with other young people who are motivated, interested in learning and developing themselves that other young people will be 'sparked' in their interest to earn similar placements locally, nationally,  and eventually internationally as well. 

We expect to reach a position where we can offer placement opportunities for young people from Coventry and Warwickshire to volunteer elsewhere in Europe to make lasting positive contributions and support a new generation of


Duration of service for the volunteers is 12 months, the project takes place in Coventry (West Midlands UK)
Jugendwerk der AWO Wuerttemberg e.V and Coventry and Sutton ColdfieldYMCA are commitment to prepare the logistic in order to send and received the volunteers ( travel, accommodation, insurance, safety and protection of participants, visa, social security, mentoring and support, preparatory meetings with partners etc.) according with the standards of the Erasmus + programme.

By hosting a volunteer, we want to make the volunteer aware of how valued their contribution to this work will be. We are offering a youth work/childrens programme for young volunteers,  a training programme about cultural diversity/life skills for young people, a programme for young people with disabilities, a programme for young people in a caring role of either a parent or sibling . Further more we cooperate with the local churches and schools in several projects for children together. (including youth clubs)
Duration of service for the volunteers is 12 months, the project takes place in Sutton Coldfield (Birmingham UK)

Building Bridges and Sutton ColdfieldYMCA are committed to prepare the logistics in order to send and receive the volunteers ( travel, accommodation, insurance, safety and protection of participants, visa, social security, mentoring and support, preparatory meetings with partners etc.) according with the standards of the Erasmus + programme.  Our aim is to build on previous experience and to work together to ensure a quality project that supports volunteers in line with the Erasmus plus programme.
